title: Scoreboard: Verify that the Scoreboard flips to the next day at 10 AM EST as long as the season isn't over
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And that the season isn't over
And the time is before 10 AM EST
custom_steps: When the time hits 10 AM EST
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard will flip to the next day

title: Scoreboard: Setting device to different timezones (Eastern, Central, Mountain & Pacific) will allow it to reflect games correctly for that timezone.  If it falls outside those timezones it will then default to Eastern
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard
And there are games on the Scoreboard that haven't been played yet
custom_steps:
When we set the devices timezone to Eastern (ET)
And we set the devices timezone to Central (CT)
And we set the devices timezone to Mountain (MT)
And we set the devices timezone to Pacific (PT)
And we set the devices timezone to one outside the above range
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard will display the games in the appropriate time from the appropriate time zone

title: Scoreboard: Games will be sorted by game state and chronological order
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And there are some games completed
And there are some games in progress
And there are some games not started as of yet
And the user doesn't have a Favorite Team set
custom_expected:
Then the games will be sorted by game state with the finished games at the bottom
And the games not started will be sorted by the time of that particular game above the finished games
And the games in progress will be sorted by the time of that particular game above the finished games

title: Scoreboard: Order of games on a given day should be Regular Season, followed by Spring Training, followed by Exhibition and will have the sorting rules from the previous section applied (C550)
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And there are some regular season games displayed
And there are some spring training games displayed
And there are some exhibition games displayed
And the user doesn't have a Favorite Team set
custom_expected: Then the games will be sorted by Regular Season first followed by Spring Training & Exhibition based games

title: Scoreboard: Favorite Team's game will always remain at the top regardless of the state of that particular game
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And the user has a Favorite Team set
custom_expected: Then the top game on the Scoreboard will always be the Favorite Team's game no matter the state of that particular game unless it's an Exhibition game

title: Scoreboard: Favorite Team will have a star next to it's name
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And the user has set a Favorite Team
custom_expected: Then the Favorite Team will appear on the Scoreboard with a star to the right of it's name

title: Scoreboard: Multiple Favorite teams will all have the star to the right of their name on the Scoreboard indicating that they are a favorite team
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard
And we have multiple Favorite Teams selected
custom_expected: Then all Favorite Teams that have been selected will have a star to the right of their name indicating that they are a favorite team

title: Scoreboard: Multiple Favorite teams will display in the order that they were originally set to by the user in settings
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have multiple Favorite Teams set
custom_expected: Then the multiple favorite teams will display on the scoreboard in the order that they were set as favorite teams

title: Scoreboard: Text and game state formatting on games should be clear and readable
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And there are games present on the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then all text and game state formatting will be clear & readable

title: Scoreboard: Games displayed on the Scoreboard have the correct Inning, Score and Base Runner Indicator shown
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have games in progress
custom_expected:
Then the games displayed are showing the correct inning
And the games displayed are showing the correct score
And the games displayed are showing the correct base runner indicator

title: Scoreboard: Tapping a game cell on the Scoreboard expands that games cell
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_steps: When we tap on a game cell that isn't expanded
custom_expected: Then that game cell will expand

title: Scoreboard: On an Expanded Game Cell if the game hasn't started yet then we will see team logos, records, game start time, field name and ticket button
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have games present on the Scoreboard
And we have tapped on one of the game cells that is in a preview state to expand it
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the team logos are visible
And that the team records are visible
And that the game start time is visible
And that the field name is visible
And that the ticket button is visible

title: Scoreboard: On an Expanded Game Cell if the game has started then we will see a linescore, gameday button, video button, audio button and box score button
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have games present on the Scoreboard
And we have tapped on one of the game cells that is in an in progress state to expand it
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the linescore is visible
And that the gameday button is visible
And that the box score button is visible
And that the video button is visible
And that the audio button is visible

title: Scoreboard: On an Expanded Game Cell if the game is in a final state then we will see a linescore, gameday button, box score button, and video button present
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have games present on the Scoreboard
And we have tapped on one of the game cells that is in a final state to expand it
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the linescore is visible
And that the gameday button is visible
And that the box score button is visible
And that the video button is visible

title: Scoreboard: Games on the Scoreboard will update their state, score and scheduling automatically based off of the 15 second refresh rate
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have games appearing on that date
custom_expected: Then the games in question will update their state, score and scheduling automatically.  The default refresh rate is about 15 seconds, which is now fixed in app and not configurable.

title: Scoreboard: All team names and logos appear correctly and up to date
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_expected: Then all team names and logos appear correctly & up to date

title: Scoreboard: Day to Day Navigation works forward and backwards
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
And the day we are at is not the first day season
Or the day we are at is not the last day of the season
custom_steps:
When we tap the forward navigation buttons
Or we tap the backwards navigation buttons
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard updates to the appropriate date

title: Scoreboard: Date Navigation is bound to the appropriate season
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we know the bound dates
custom_expected:
Then we can't navigate earlier then the beginning of the season
And we can't navigate past the ending of the season

title: Scoreboard: Verify that the Scoreboard season end date can be extended and that we can then navigate to that new date
custom_preconds:
Given we have configuration assistance by someone who can change it
And that person has changed the season end date
And we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_expected: Then we can navigate to that new season end date

title: Scoreboard: The linescore detail appears correctly for games currently in progress, finalized, completed early and/or completed with extra innings
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_steps: When we select a game in a particular state
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the game state is correct
And that the win loss records are correct
And that the innings displayed are correct
And that the runs per innings are correct
And that the runs are correct
And that the hits are correct
And that the errors are correct
And that the winning pitcher is correct if the game is finalized
And that the losing pitcher is correct if the game is finalized

REPEAT for each Game State

title: Scoreboard: When a game has Extra Innings all innings are scrollable on the linescore
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have found a game that has extra innings
And we have expanded that games cell
custom_expected: Then we can navigate back and forth between all the innings on the linescore

title: Scoreboard: When a game moves from a Preview state to a Warmup state then the Ticket Button will disappear from the Expanded game cell
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have found a game that has changed to Warmup status
And we have expanded that games cell
custom_expected: Then we will see that the Ticket button has disappeared from the Expanded Cell

title: Scoreboard: Scoreboard will update immediately when application is brought to the foreground after being in the background
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have sent the application to the background
And we have brought the application back to the foreground
custom_expected: Then the scoreboard will update immediately

title: Scoreboard: The Scoreboard will default back to Today if it's brought back to the foreground after being backgrounded for more than an hour
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have set it's date to another day
And we have sent the application to the background
And the application has been in the background for at least an hour
And we have then brought the application to the foreground
custom_expected: Then the will appear on Today's date

title: Scoreboard: On a day with no games "No Scheduled Games" will be displayed on the Scoreboard
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_steps: When we have found a date with no games being played
custom_expected: Then "No Scheduled Games" is displayed on the Scoreboard

title: Scoreboard: Verify that the MLB.TV Game of the Day is visibile on the Scoreboard for Lite users
custom_preconds:
Given we are utilizing the Lite version of the application
And we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_expected: Then the MLB.TV Game of the Day will be visible

title: Scoreboard: Home teams are always listed after Away teams
custom_preconds: Given there is a game scheduled for that date
custom_steps:
When the user open up the app 
And go to the scoreboard
custom_expected:
Then you will see:
- the home team listed underneath the away team
- when you tap the game, the away team is listed on the left and the home team to the right

title: Verify: User can swipe left and right on scoreboard page
custom_preconds:
Given the app as been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard screen
custom_steps: When the user swipes left or right on the scoreboard
custom_expected: Then the scoreboard should move forward or backward one day according to the direction the user swiped.

title: Scoreboard [IAB-4106]: Verify that when a game has been completed early that it's displayed as 'Final/n'
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND there is a game available that has been 'Completed Early'
custom_expected: THEN the game that has been 'Completed Early' will read as 'Final/n' instead of mentioning 'Completed Early'

title: Scoreboard [IAB-4116]: Verify that if we hit the Audio button on a Game Tile then that games Audio will begin to play
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the 'Scoreboard'
AND we tap on an active 'Game Tile'
AND we tap on the 'Audio' button
custom_expected: THEN that games Audio Stream will successfully start up

title: Scoreboard [IAB-4340]: Verify that the Scoreboard will not refresh to the current day when the user is on another day
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to another day on the Scoreboard
AND we select the Video Tab from a completed game
AND we start up an Archived Game
AND we close the Archived Game down
AND we move back to the Scoreboard
custom_expected:
THEN we will remain on the appropriate day on the Scoreboard
AND we will not be reset to 'Today'

title: Scoreboard [IAB-4451]: Verify that we can access the Box Score on a finalized game as a Lite user
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
AND we are utilizing the Application in Lite Mode
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND we tap on a completed game's Box Score icon
custom_expected: THEN the Box Score will successfully open

title: Scoreboard [IAB-4494]: Verify that the Scoreboard won't get stuck between days if the user suddenly hits a button while transitioning between days
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND we navigate between days
AND we tap on a Tab Bar button to switch off gameday while between the days
AND we tap on the Scoreboard Tab Bar button again
custom_expected: THEN the Scoreboard will NOT be stuck between days

title: Scoreboard [IAB-4668]: Verify that opening the last cell on the iPhone scoreboard doesn't display a funky fresh animation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND we open up the 'Last Cell' on the Scoreboard
custom_expected: THEN their will be NO funky fresh animation displayed

title: Scoreboard [IAB-4810]: Verify if we have a Regular Double Header that the Detail Information shows up correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND we navigate to a date that contains a regular "Double Header"
AND we open up the Detail View of each game
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that the Pitchers are listed correctly
AND we will see that the Tickets button is available
AND we will see that the Promotions button is available

title: Scoreboard [IAB-4810]: Verify that if we have a Back-to-Back Double Header that the Detail Information shows up correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND we navigate to a date that contains a "Back-To-Back" double header
AND we open up the Detail View of each game
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that the Pitchers are listed correctly
AND we will see that the Tickets button is available on the first game
AND we will see that the Tickets button isn't available on the second game
AND we will see that the Promotions button is available

title: Scoreboard [IAB-5025]: Verify that if we background the application and bring it back that the Scoreboard is performing a silent refresh
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scorebaord
AND we background the Application
AND we bring the Application back
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that the Scoreboard refreshes silently
AND we will see that the Scoreboard will not appear to clear itself before it refreshes itself

title: Scoreboard [IAB-5065]: Verify if we background the application and come back after an hour that the Scoreboard updates appropriately
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND we background it for an hour
AND we bring the application back up
custom_expected: THEN it will update appropriately

title: Scoreboard: Verify pressing the Hide Scores button on the Scoreboad EPG hides scores
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND has the General Setting of "Hide scores for all games" disabled
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND there are in progress games on the day
AND there are games in the final state on the day
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses the Hide Scores button in the top right corner of the Scoreboard EPG
custom_expected:
THEN the scores will be hidden
AND if the user navigates to the General Settings the "Hide scores for all games" setting will show as checked

title: Scoreboard: Verify pressing the Show Scores button on the Scoreboard EPG restores scores
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND has the General Setting of "Hide scores for all games" enabled
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND there are in progress games on the day
AND there are games in the final state on the day
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses the Show Scores button from the top right corner of the Scoreboard EPG
custom_expected:
THEN the scores will appear
AND if the user navigates to the General Settings the "Hide scores for all games" setting will show as unchecked

title: Verify: The number of games on each day will match the number of games listed on the calendar picker
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the Scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user taps the Date at the top of the scoreboard screen
custom_expected:
Then the Calendar picker will appear
And the number of games listed on each date in the calendar should match the number of games scheduled for that date.

title: Scoreboard: When tapping on the date then a calendar picker will appear
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When we tap on the date in the top of the scoreboard
custom_expected: Then the Calendar picker appears

title: Scenario: User scrolls left and right on Calendar picker
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has launched the Calendar picker
custom_steps: When the user swipes left and right on the calendar
custom_expected: Then the calendar should flip to show the newly selected month.

title: User taps forward and back arrows on calendar picker
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has launched the Calendar picker
custom_steps: When the user taps left or right on the calendar
custom_expected: Then the calendar should adjust and show the newly selected month.

title: User scrolls using month scroll bar on bottom of calendar picker
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has launched the calendar picker
custom_steps: When the user scrolls left and right along the bottom scroll bar
custom_expected: Then the month selected should quickly adjust as the user slides back and forth

title: User selects a date in the Calendar
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has launched the calendar picker
custom_steps: When the user selects a date on the calendar picker
custom_expected:
Then the calendar picker should disappear
And the user should be taken back to the scoreboard page
And the date that the user is left on should be the newly selected date

title: User taps 'Today' button in Calendar picker
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
And the user is on a date that is different than today's date
custom_steps:
When the user taps the Date in the top of the scoreboard
And the user taps the 'Today' button in the top of the calendar picker
custom_expected:
Then the calendar picker should disappear
And the user should be brought to the scoreboard page
And the date the user is on should be 'Todays' date

title: Verify: Date that user has selected matches date on calendar
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user taps the Date at the top of the scoreboard page
custom_expected:
Then the calendar picker should appear
And the date that the user has selected should appear selected in the calendar picker.

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify that when a game is in the state of "Game Over" that it's displayed as "Final"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND there is a game that has completed
custom_steps: WHEN we look at that particular game
custom_expected:
THEN the game cell will NOT reflect the inning state anywhere
AND the game cell will reflect instead the words Final
AND the Base Runner Indicator will no longer be visible in the game cell
AND the team logos will be correct
AND the team scores will be correct
AND the team names will be correct

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify that a game finishing in less then 9 innings will appear as Final/<inningsPlayed>
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND there is a game available in a state of final
AND this particular game was finished in less then 9 innings
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the game cell in question
custom_expected: THEN the game will show as Final/<inningsPlayed>

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify that if a game finishes in the normal 9 innings that it reflects as Final on the Scoreboard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND we have a game that has finished in 9 innings
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the game cell in question
custom_expected: THEN the game cell will reflect the state of Final for that particular game

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify that a game finishing in Extra Innings will appear as Final/<inningsPlayed>
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND there is a game available in a state of Finalâ€¨
AND this particular game was finished in greater then 9 innings
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the game cell in question
custom_expected: THEN the game will show as Final/<inningsPlayed>

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify an in game "Ceremony" reflects correctly on the Scoreboard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND there is a game in the state of Ceremony available
custom_steps: WHEN we look at that particular game
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that the inning is still shown
AND we will see that the word "Ceremony" appears under the inning in question

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify that when a game goes into a state of Replay that it is correctly reflected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND there is a game in the state of Replay available
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the game in the state of Replay
custom_expected:
THEN the scoreboard will reflect the correct inning state followed by inning
AND below this there will be the words Replay

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify that a game in a state of Delay reflects properly on the Scoreboard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND there is a game in the state of Delay available
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the game in question
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the correct <inningState><inningNumber> being displayed
AND below that we will see the word "Delay"

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify that a Postponed Game reflects correctly on the Scoreboard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND we have a game in the state of Postpone available
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the game in question
custom_expected:
THEN the game cell will NOT reflect the inning state anywhere
AND the game cell will reflect instead the words Postponed
AND the game cell will have the Postponed reason under the words Postponed
AND the basepad indicator will be removed
AND the team logos will be correct
AND the team names will be correct

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify that a resumption of a suspended game with no probable pitchers reflects properly on the Scoreboard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND the game is a resumption of a suspended game
AND there are no probable pitchers set for the game.
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the game in question
custom_expected:
THEN the scoreboard's game cell will show the game time
AND shows 'Susp' beneath the game time
AND the score will be shown on the scoreboard
AND there will not be innings shown on the scoreboard
AND below the game cell will display 'Game is resumed from <M><D><YYYY>

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify that a game in a state of Forfeit reflects properly on the Scoreboard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
AND there is a game in the state of Forfeit available
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the game in question
custom_expected:
THEN the game will NOT show the innings on the Scoreboard
AND the game will show the words Forfeit instead
AND under the words Forfeit we will see the reason

title: Scoreboard (Game States): Verify that when a game has been "Completed Early" that it's displayed as 'Final/n'
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND there is a game available that has been 'Completed Early'
custom_expected: THEN the game that has been 'Completed Early' will read as 'Final/n' instead of mentioning 'Completed Early'

title: Scoreboard: Verify that if we have a Back-to-Back Double Header that the Detail Information shows up correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND we navigate to a date that contains a "Back-To-Back" double header
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that the games are listed correctly
AND the second game should be labeled as "Game 2"

title: Scoreboard: Verify if we have a Regular Double Header that the Detail Information shows up correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed and launched the MLB.TV Mac app
AND the user has accessed the Scoreboard EPG
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND we navigate to a date that contains a regular "Double Header"
AND we open up the Detail View of each game
custom_expected: THEN we will see that the games are listed correctly
